item.description: Overview The Chinese remainder theorem states that whenever we have an unknown number, but we know its remainders when divided by a few coprime integers, we can find what that number is. Basically, we are given some numbers which are pairwise coprime, and given remainders when an unknown number x is divided by them. We need to find the minimum possible value of x that produces given remainders.
